# Rawdata Quality Control

## fastqc (v0.12.1)

> FastQC: Comprehensive Quality Control for Sequence Data<br>- Generates HTML reports and data zip files<br>- Supports automated extraction for direct data parsing<br>- Singularity-based execution for environment consistency

### Execution Script
실제 분석을 구동하기 위해 사용자가 실행하는 래퍼(Wrapper) 스크립트입니다.

```bash
python /storage/home/jhkim/scripts/bioscript/pipeline/cbNIPT/v3.0.0/scripts/run_fastqc_singularity_pe_qc_extract.py [arguments...]
```

### Local Command (Internal)
스크립트 내부에서 설정값을 조합하여 실행되는 명령어입니다.

```bash
[singularity_bin] exec -B [bind] [sif] [fastqc_bin] [fastqc_args] --threads \
  [Threads] --outdir [qcResDir] [RawFastqDir]/[SeqID]_R1.fastq.gz \
  [RawFastqDir]/[SeqID]_R2.fastq.gz
```

### Parameters & I/O

::: {style="font-size: 0.85em;"}

#### Inputs
| Argument | Required | Description |
|:---|:---|:---|
| `SeqID` | ✅ | Sequence identifier used to locate FASTQ files |
| `RawFastqDir` | ✅ | Directory containing raw or trimmed FASTQ files |
| `qcResDir` | ✅ | Directory where FastQC reports will be saved |

: {tbl-colwidths="[20, 12, 28, 40]"}

#### Outputs
| Argument | Default | Description |
|:---|:---|:---|
| `r1_html` | [qcResDir]/[SeqID]_R1_fastqc.html | Quality report for Read 1 in HTML |
| `r2_html` | [qcResDir]/[SeqID]_R2_fastqc.html | Quality report for Read 2 in HTML |
| `r1_zip` | [qcResDir]/[SeqID]_R1_fastqc.zip | Data zip file for Read 1 |
| `r2_zip` | [qcResDir]/[SeqID]_R2_fastqc.zip | Data zip file for Read 2 |
| `r1_dir` | [qcResDir]/[SeqID]_R1_fastqc | Extracted report directory for Read 1 |
| `r2_dir` | [qcResDir]/[SeqID]_R2_fastqc | Extracted report directory for Read 2 |

: {tbl-colwidths="[20, 12, 28, 40]"}

#### Parameters
| Argument | Default | Description |
|:---|:---|:---|
| `singularity_bin` | singularity | Path to singularity executable |
| `fastqc_bin` | fastqc | FastQC binary name inside container |
| `sif` | /storage/images/fastqc-0.12.1.sif | Path to FastQC SIF image |
| `bind` | /storage,/data | Mount paths for singularity exec |
| `Threads` | 8 | Number of threads (FastQC processes files in parallel) |
| `fastqc_args` | --extract | Additional FastQC flags (e.g., --extract, --nogroup) |

: {tbl-colwidths="[20, 12, 28, 40]"}

:::
